cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Drifting north-northwest, then turning northwest to make landfall along the South Carolina coast Saturday evening before curving northeast and moving back offshore along the mid-Atlantic coast early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina coast between Charleston and Myrtle Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach, SC to Cape Lookout, NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast U.S. coast (GA–NC) this weekend; Mid-Atlantic and southern New England coasts early next week
weather_observation.wind: Gusty east to northeast winds (20–30 kt) possible Monday night into Tuesday as the remnant low passes offshore; tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (≤7 % probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – only minor tidal run-up of 1 ft or less expected along New Jersey shoreline.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Monday into Tuesday which could cause brief ponding on terminals and slow cargo operations.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the New Jersey beaches beginning late Monday.
